sections.heading: What is Flovers?
body: Flovers is a plant-care companion that helps you organize daily care, track plant history, and monitor live sensor readings from your own IoT devices.
The app combines reminders and tasks with plant profiles (your plants) and plant definitions (built-in species profiles with recommendations).
Flovers is designed to support your decisions, not replace them—plant care outcomes depend on your environment and how you apply recommendations.
The Service includes a mobile app (Android; iOS planned), a backend API, and a web landing page that hosts documentation and legal information.

sections.heading: Key concepts (how the app is structured)
body: Plant Definition: a built-in species profile containing general traits and care recommendations (light, watering/misting intervals, fertilizing, etc.).
Plant Instance: your personal plant entry (your own specimen), optionally linked to a Plant Definition to receive guidance and suggested defaults.
Reminder: a recurring rule (e.g., water every X days) that generates Tasks automatically over time.
Task: a concrete actionable item created from a Reminder; you can complete it and optionally add notes to build a care history.

sections.heading: Main features at a glance
body: Account system: register, log in, confirm e-mail, reset password, and manage profile settings.
Plant management: create plants, group them with Locations, keep notes, and review history to see what was done and when.
Reminders & tasks: define recurring care routines (watering, misting, fertilising, repotting, care) and complete tasks as you go.
IoT readings: connect your own device(s) and store readings such as air temperature, air humidity, soil moisture, and light level.

sections.heading: Plant recognition (photo-based)
body: Flovers can recognize plants from a photo to help you find the closest matching Plant Definition and start with better defaults.
Recognition is performed server-side using the Provider’s own machine learning system trained on 700+ plant species.
Photos provided for recognition are used only to perform the recognition step and are not intended to be stored permanently.
Results depend on lighting, focus, plant visibility, and the plant’s similarity to other species in the dataset.

sections.heading: IoT devices and sensor data
body: Flovers supports user-built or third-party devices (e.g., Arduino-based) that send sensor readings to your account.
Supported readings include: air temperature, air humidity, soil moisture, and light level.
Readings are stored in the backend and presented in the app as a current status view and as historical summaries (daily/weekly/monthly).
You control pairing and usage—device stability, calibration, and physical setup remain your responsibility.

sections.heading: QR codes and quick access
body: You can generate QR codes that contain a link to a specific Plant Instance in your account.
A typical workflow is to print and attach the QR code to a pot, then scan it to jump directly to plant details and readings.
QR codes are meant for convenience; treat them like access pointers and don’t share them publicly if they expose sensitive metadata.
At the moment, plant details are intended to be visible only to the logged-in owner of the plant.

sections.heading: Notifications and reminders
body: Flovers can send push notifications (via Firebase) for tasks that are due or overdue, depending on your settings.
You can configure notifications in Profile & Settings; reminders remain inside the app even if notifications are disabled.
Email messages are currently used mainly for account-related actions (activation and password reset).
Notifications are supportive—Flovers does not guarantee that your plants will stay healthy or that reminders prevent losses.

sections.heading: Privacy, security, and your data
body: Flovers stores account data and plant-related data needed to provide the Service (plants, reminders, tasks, notes, and sensor readings).
Passwords are stored in hashed form; account activation is confirmed via email verification.
Flovers aims to keep data within the EU; hosting is planned on Hetzner (EU) and push notifications use Firebase.
For details, always refer to the Privacy Policy and the Terms of Service available on the website and in the app.

sections.heading: Limits and important disclaimers
body: Flovers is a tool for planning and monitoring; it is not a professional advisory system and does not replace expertise.
Sensor readings may be inaccurate due to calibration, placement, or device issues; verify critical decisions manually.
Plant care guidance is general and may not match your specific conditions (substrate, pot size, light, humidity, season).
If something looks wrong, use your judgment—adjust routines and consult reliable horticultural sources when needed.

sections.heading: Where to go next
body: If you’re new, start with Login & Register, then create your first Plant Instance using the Create Plant Wizard.
Next, set up Reminders and complete Tasks to build a consistent routine and a useful task history.
If you have a device, open Readings to pair it and then use Readings History to spot trends.
Use the FAQ for quick answers and the Terms/Privacy documents for legal and data-processing details.
